citeinfo.origin: NC Division of Parks and Recreation
citeinfo.title: RegionalTrails

descript.abstract: Regional Trails Inventory. State, regional, and local trail inventory. Data collected by partners across the state. Owner, manager, and maintainer information for planned trails or trail segments may be substituted for sponsor or coordinator information.
descript.purpose: Provide locations for existing and planned trails/greenways for management and planning of trail systems that cross jurisdictional boundaries. Common knowledge of existing and planned trails will aid cooperation and efficient use of resources.

idinfo.useconst: Acknowledgement of products derived from this data. While efforts have been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the state of the art, DPR cannot assume liability for any damages or misrepresentation caused by any inaccuracies in the data or as a result of changes to the data caused by system transfers.

cntorgp.cntorg: NC Division of Parks and Recreation

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

dataqual.complete: Incomplete. Data collection in the early phases for all regions.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Name of the park or greenway that contains the trail or trail segment.
For existing trails, owner of the land for the trail or trail segment. List "Private" for any privately owned segments. For planned trails, the owner is the owner of the plan.
Manager of trail or trail segment. For planned trails, list the proposed manager.
Name that the trail or trail segment is officially known by

edom.edomvd: Planned trail identified by an appropriate management decision
A trail that is no longer needed and has been removed from service

attr.attrdef: Current physical state of being of the trail or trail segment

edom.edomvd: Horse trail (= "Pack - pack and saddle" from FTDS)

attr.attrdef: The modes of travel that are actively managed and appropriate considering the design and management of the trail. Multiple values are permitted, separate with a space.

edom.edomvd: Other trail surface type (including paver block, geogrid, etc)

attr.attrdef: The predominant surface type the user would expect to encounter on the trail or trail segment
The predominant width likely to be encountered on the trail or trail segment
The length of the trail or trail segment (miles)

edom.edomvd: Measurment made from mapping grade GPS and differentially corrected
Measurment made from recreational grade GPS
Measured line on a scale map

attr.attrdef: Measurment method used to determine LENGTH
Yes or No. Is there a brochure avaiable for the trail or trail segment
Maintainer of the trail or trail segment (often a volunteer group)

edom.edomvd: State Trail as designated by DPR
Regional trail, crosses jurisdictional boundaries or of significant mileage
Local trail, usually stays within the a limited area or of short mileage
National Trail as designated by a Federal Agency

attr.attrdef: General class of trail or trail segment

distinfo.distliab: Please do not distribute. Ask for latest layer from John Amoroso from NC Division of Parks and Recreation.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Provide locations for existing and planned trails/greenways for management and planning of trail systems that cross jurisdictional boundaries. Common knowledge of existing and planned trails will aid cooperation and efficient use of resources
dataIdInfo.idAbs: Regional Trails Inventory. State, regional, and local trail inventory. Data collected by partners across the state. Owner, manager, and maintainer information for planned trails or trail segments may be substituted for sponsor or coordinator information

Consts.useLimit: Acknowledgement of products derived from this data. While efforts have been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the state of the art, DPR cannot assume liability for any damages or misrepresentation caused by any inaccuracies in the data or as a result of changes to the data caused by system transfers
